Name: Antelope shaped vase
Description: Libation vase in the shape of a tied up antelope, whose legs are used as the handle. The vase's neck is the antelope's neck, the liquid pouring out from his mouth. On the back of its head there are two holes for inserting the horns, possibly worked in a different material. Coming from Abydos, it could be considered one of the Egyptian  prototypes of the vases found by Reisner in Meroe, showing the same typology.
